text:
AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF UNIVERSITY WOMEN
24-01 VIRGINIA AVENUE, N.W. WASHINGTON ~7, D.C.
April 8, 1963
Miss Marion Corwell
Associate Director — School Relations
Dearborn Public Schools
5757 Neckel
Dearborn, Michigan
Dear Miss Corwell:
Thank you for your letter of April 5»
I was rather surprised to learn from your letter that NAEB
was asking me to serve another term on the Public Relations Com¬
mittee. In view of my inexperience in publicity, which seems
to be the main concern of the PR Committee, I do not believe
I could make any real contribution to the committee's work.
Furthermore, AAUW plans to abolish its Mass Media program as of
June 30, and I shall no longer be serving as Associate for Mass
Media.
Under the circumstances, I am sure you will understand my
reluctance to accept a reappointment to the committee. I am
writing to Mr, Harley to express my regret that I cannot continue
to serve.
With best wishes for the committee's future,
Sincerely,
/'IjXmccl*
Frances E. Butler
Staff Associate -
Mass Media
FEB:cbe
